beliefs.claim: Bilal runs Nur Coop (Nur Creative Studios) - an Etsy shop selling ethically-sourced essential oils from India and Lebanon (Petrichor, Neroli, Amber, Sandalwood) with 3,339 sales and 5-star reviews
beliefs.reasoning: This entire conversation is about optimizing Etsy listings for Nur Coop. Shop has significant traction (3,339 sales, 534 reviews, mostly 5-star). Sells unique oils like Petrichor (smell of rain), Neroli from Lebanon, Sandalwood from India.

beliefs.claim: Bilal values 'Good Globalization' - connecting the planet through products by collaborating with craftspeople from around the world, sharing beauty of people and lands that create products
beliefs.reasoning: Explicitly states this as Nur Creative Studios' mission. Not exploitative globalization but connection, collaboration, celebrating producers. Personally travels to source oils, makes videos showing producers and places.

evidence.quote: 'Good Globalization' - connect a the planet through our products by collaborating with crafts people from around the world
evidence.speaker: user

evidence.quote: We personally travel to Kannauj, India, to source our oils directly from the producers, ensuring that our products are ethically made, fairly traded
evidence.speaker: user

evidence.quote: Our mission is to share the beauty of the world with others and celebrate the people and lands that create these enchanting scents
evidence.speaker: user

beliefs.claim: Bilal values creating products that give people 'a sense of the sublime' - not just functional products but experiences that evoke beauty, memory, transcendence
beliefs.reasoning: First stated aim of Nur Creative Studios: 'Create products which give people a sense of the sublime.' Customer reviews show this works: 'transported', 'memories', 'wild', 'nature'. Petrichor evokes rain, Neroli evokes sunny climates.

evidence.quote: Create products which give people a sense of the sublime
evidence.speaker: user

evidence.quote: To me, it brings back memories of hot pavement at the playground when the first few raindrops hit

beliefs.claim: Bilal wants to run a company 'fueled by baraka' (blessing) - so work is blessed and money made is blessed, not just profitable but spiritually sound
beliefs.reasoning: Explicitly states goal: 'Run a company that is fueled by baraka, so that the work we do is blessed and so that the money we make is also blessed.' Islamic concept of blessed work/wealth. Connects to 'spiritually inspired, religiously inspired process.'

beliefs.claim: Bilal values creating products that 'help people know themselves, each other, and know how the world works' - products as educational and relational tools
beliefs.reasoning: States this as Nur Creative Studios aim. Essential oils aren't just scents - they're portals to places (India, Lebanon), memories (rain, playgrounds), self-knowledge. Same philosophy as Bloom (helping people know themselves).

evidence.quote: Create quality products that help people know themselves, each other, and know how the world works. How amazing is that?

evidence.quote: we want people to see the world as a place where beauty comes from, to see the people who make it, the land it comes from

beliefs.reasoning: States: 'Once upon a time, 10 years ago, we started a creative studio called Modati.' From 2013 to 2023 = 10 years. Simple goal ('make money doing what we love') expanded into complex mission (good globalization, baraka, sublime).

values_cards.title: Good Globalization - Connecting Through Beauty
attention_policies: CRAFTSPEOPLE whose traditional methods create products of beauty and meaning
LANDS and places whose specific geography produces unique materials (Kannauj clay, Lebanese orange blossoms)
STORIES that show who made the product and where it comes from - making invisible labor visible
COLLABORATIONS where both producer and customer gain meaning and connection, not just money
MOMENTS when a customer experiences a place through a product (smelling Lebanon, touching India)
WAYS products can help people 'see the world as a place where beauty comes from'

quotes: 'Good Globalization' - connect a the planet through our products by collaborating with crafts people from around the world
we want people to see the world as a place where beauty comes from, to see the people who make it, the land it comes from
Travel with us to Lebanon and smell the world!
We personally travel to Kannauj, India, to source our oils directly from the producers
stories: Traveled to Kannauj, India to source Petrichor oil from unique lake, made video showing place and process
Visited traditional soap makers in Saida, Lebanon in 2017, returned to source more oils
Created videos showing sourcing trips - transparency about origin

values_cards.title: Products That Evoke The Sublime
attention_policies: SENSORY EXPERIENCES that transport people to another place or time (rain on pavement, sunny Lebanon, forest after storm)
MEMORIES triggered by scent - childhood playgrounds, summer rain, damp earth
MOMENTS when ordinary things (dirt, rain, flowers) become transcendent through attention
REACTIONS from customers that go beyond 'good product' to 'I am transported', 'I am in love', 'deceased from adoration'
QUALITIES that make a scent evoke nature, wildness, organic life rather than synthetic perfume
WAYS products can give 'a sense of the sublime' - beauty that touches something deeper

quotes: Create products which give people a sense of the sublime
To me, it brings back memories of hot pavement at the playground when the first few raindrops hit
The neroli is so vibrant and delicious--I adore it and am immediately transported to a sunny climate
I can't describe exactly how it smells... 'nature', 'wild', 'organic'. But it smells wonderful
deceased from love and adoration for it
stories: Petrichor oil evokes rain - customers say 'wet soil', 'rain on pavement', 'summer storm'
Customer used Petrichor to create cocktail 'Rain On The Patio'
Neroli transports to sunny climates, sandalwood creates serenity for meditation

values_cards.title: Baraka - Blessed Commerce
attention_policies: WAYS the work itself can be blessed - not just profitable but spiritually sound
PROCESSES that honor religious/spiritual values in business (fair trade, ethical sourcing, blessed money)
RELATIONSHIPS with producers that are collaborative and mutually meaningful, not extractive
CHOICES in business that align with values of justice, beauty, blessing
PRODUCTS that carry baraka (blessing) from their origin, process, intention
QUESTIONS: Is the money blessed? Is the work blessed? Does this create meaning for all involved?

quotes: Run a company that is fueled by baraka, so that the work we do is blessed and so that the money we make is also blessed
elements of ethical, spiritually inspired, religiously inspired process
Create a vehicle through which we meaning for the employees, partner producers, and customers
fairly traded, and of the highest quality
stories: Nur Creative Studios mission explicitly includes baraka (Islamic blessing)
Fair trade, ethical sourcing not just for marketing but spiritual alignment
Creating meaning for producers (India, Lebanon) not just customers

book_material.claim: 'Good Globalization' - connecting planet through products by collaborating with craftspeople, celebrating people and lands that create beauty
book_material.why_book_worthy: Original concept of ethical globalization. Not anti-globalization but GOOD globalization - connection not extraction. Book D (Islamic Values + Tech/Commerce) or Book F (Cross-Cultural). Shows how to do international commerce with values.

book_material.claim: Products that give 'sense of the sublime' - Petrichor (rain smell), Neroli (sunny Lebanon), creating transcendent experiences through sensory products
book_material.why_book_worthy: Beautiful philosophy. Products aren't just functional - they transport, evoke memories, create sublime moments. Customer reviews prove it works. Book D - integrating beauty/spirituality with commerce.

book_material.claim: Baraka-fueled company - work is blessed, money is blessed, not just profitable but spiritually sound
book_material.why_book_worthy: PERFECT for Book D (Islamic Values in Secular/Tech Work). Applying Islamic concept of baraka to e-commerce. How to make money ethically and spiritually. Nur Coop as case study.

book_material.claim: Storytelling transparency - videos of sourcing trips, showing craftspeople and places, 'Travel with us and smell the world!'
book_material.why_book_worthy: Innovative marketing approach. Not just 'ethically sourced' claim but VIDEO PROOF. Transparency as value and marketing strategy. Book D or E (social good through commerce).

book_material.claim: Petrichor oil - smell of rain on earth (geosmin), sourced from unique lake in Kannauj, 230 5-star reviews, customers say 'wet soil', 'summer rain'
book_material.why_book_worthy: Signature product with poetic appeal. Shows how to find unique products (not competing with Amazon). Petrichor as example of sublime product. Book D case study.

book_material.claim: Products help people 'know themselves, each other, and know how the world works' - educational mission through commerce
book_material.why_book_worthy: Same mission as Bloom! Commerce as education, connection, self-knowledge. Connects Nur Coop to larger life mission. Book A (Integrated Approach) - all work serves same values.

analysis_notes.context: March 22, 2023 - Day after Deep analysis (Conv 6) and Strengths (Conv 7). Bilal optimizing Etsy shop Nur Coop. Shop has 3,339 sales, 534 reviews, mostly 5-star. Sells essential oils: Petrichor (India), Neroli (Lebanon), Amber (Lebanon), Sandalwood (India). Started as 'Modati' 10 years ago (2013), evolved into Nur Creative Studios.
analysis_notes.key_insight: This is Bilal's FIRST attempt at integrated values-based business (before Bloom). Nur Coop embodies 'Good Globalization' - ethical sourcing + storytelling + spirituality (baraka) + creating sublime experiences. Same philosophy as Bloom but in commerce not training. Products 'help people know themselves and world' - same educational mission. Videos showing sourcing trips = transparency + marketing. Petrichor oil = signature poetic product (rain smell). This shows his approach WORKS - 3,339 sales proves values-based commerce viable.
analysis_notes.cross_conversation_patterns: Conv 2 (Prayer app 2024): Islamic values + tech. THIS (Nur Coop 2023): Islamic values + commerce (baraka). Conv 4 (PTG 2024): Spirituality as meaning-making. THIS: Baraka (spiritual blessing) in business. Conv 6 (March 21): 'Bringing people to life', Bloom methodology. THIS (March 22): Same philosophy in Nur Coop - products give 'sense of sublime', help people know themselves. Conv 7: Meaningful learning. THIS: Meaningful products. PATTERN: All work (Bloom, Nur, prayer app, research) serves SAME VALUES - connection, meaning, spirituality, helping people know themselves/world.
questions_for_later_convos: What happened to Nur Coop? Still active in 2024-2025?
Did Modati (2013) → Nur Creative Studios (2017?) → Nur Coop Etsy shop?
How does Nur Coop relate to Bloom? Separate businesses or integrated?
Are sourcing videos still being made? Part of ongoing marketing?
Does wife work on Nur Coop? ('my wife and I visited Lebanon')
How does 'Good Globalization' concept develop? Written about?
Petrichor as signature - any other signature products developed?
Is baraka concept explicit in marketing or just internal philosophy?
Does this e-commerce work fund Bloom? Cross-subsidy?
analysis_notes.connection_to_previous: This is the COMMERCE version of everything else: Bloom = values-based training. Nur Coop = values-based commerce. Prayer app = values-based tech. PTG research = values-based academia. ALL serve same mission: help people know themselves/world, create meaning, integrate spirituality/values with work. 'Good Globalization' here = 'Come Alive' in Bloom = spiritual integration everywhere. The CONSISTENCY is striking - Bilal applies same philosophy across domains.
analysis_notes.timeline_marker: March 22, 2023 - Started Modati 10 years ago (2013), became Nur Creative Studios, now Etsy shop with 3,339 sales
analysis_notes.business_model: Etsy e-commerce, ethically-sourced essential oils, storytelling/video marketing, fair trade, products $14-25, 3-5g bottles, free samples, handwritten notes, personal touch
